alert.note: Alert for Dorchester (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 08 at 12:12AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM EDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Maryland, including the following county, Dorchester, especially in Cambridge and nearby areas. * WHEN...Until 615 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1209 AM EDT, the public reported flooding in the warned area. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cambridge, Hurlock, Secretary, East New Market and Linkwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
